channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Competing for Shareable Arms in Multi-Player Multi-Armed Bandits
item.description: In reality, agents often have to learn and maximize the rewards of the resources at the same time.

item.title: E-PANNs: Sound Recognition Using Efficient Pre-trained Audio Neural Networks
item.description: Sounds carry an abundance of information about activities and events in our everyday environment, such as traffic noise, road works, music, or people talking.

item.title: Comparing and combining some popular NER approaches on Biomedical tasks
item.description: Lastly, we implement a system that learns to combine the predictions of SEQ and SpanPred, generating systems that consistently give high recall and high F1 across all 4 datasets.

item.title: Preserving Pre-trained Features Helps Calibrate Fine-tuned Language Models
item.description: In light of these observations, we evaluate the calibration of several methods that preserve pre-trained features and show that preserving pre-trained features can improve the calibration of fine-tuned language models.

item.title: StyleAvatar3D: Leveraging Image-Text Diffusion Models for High-Fidelity 3D Avatar Generation
item.description: The recent advancements in image-text diffusion models have stimulated research interest in large-scale 3D generative models.

item.title: Node Embedding from Neural Hamiltonian Orbits in Graph Neural Networks
item.description: In the graph node embedding problem, embedding spaces can vary significantly for different data types, leading to the need for different GNN model types.

item.title: Jointly Reparametrized Multi-Layer Adaptation for Efficient and Private Tuning
item.description: This can be a drawback for low-resource applications and training with differential-privacy constraints, where excessive noise may be introduced during finetuning.

item.title: Graph Neural Processes for Spatio-Temporal Extrapolation
item.description: We study the task of spatio-temporal extrapolation that generates data at target locations from surrounding contexts in a graph.

item.title: Learning Weakly Supervised Audio-Visual Violence Detection in Hyperbolic Space
item.description: To overcome this, we propose HyperVD, a novel framework that learns snippet embeddings in hyperbolic space to improve model discrimination.

item.title: NUNO: A General Framework for Learning Parametric PDEs with Non-Uniform Data
item.description: The neural operator has emerged as a powerful tool in learning mappings between function spaces in PDEs.

item.title: How Does Information Bottleneck Help Deep Learning?
item.description: In this paper, we provide the first rigorous learning theory for justifying the benefit of information bottleneck in deep learning by mathematically relating information bottleneck to generalization errors.

item.title: Subequivariant Graph Reinforcement Learning in 3D Environments
item.description: Learning a shared policy that guides the locomotion of different agents is of core interest in Reinforcement Learning (RL), which leads to the study of morphology-agnostic RL.

item.title: Blockwise Stochastic Variance-Reduced Methods with Parallel Speedup for Multi-Block Bilevel Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we consider non-convex multi-block bilevel optimization (MBBO) problems, which involve $m\gg 1$ lower level problems and have important applications in machine learning.

item.title: AnoOnly: Semi-Supervised Anomaly Detection without Loss on Normal Data
item.description: Unlike existing SSAD methods that resort to strict loss supervision, AnoOnly suspends it and introduces a form of weak supervision for normal data.

item.title: Shuo Wen Jie Zi: Rethinking Dictionaries and Glyphs for Chinese Language Pre-training
item.description: We introduce CDBERT, a new learning paradigm that enhances the semantics understanding ability of the Chinese PLMs with dictionary knowledge and structure of Chinese characters.

item.title: Wrapped Cauchy Distributed Angular Softmax for Long-Tailed Visual Recognition
item.description: The class-wise distribution of angular representation becomes a sum of these kernels.

item.title: Graph-based Multi-ODE Neural Networks for Spatio-Temporal Traffic Forecasting
item.description: Current works primarily rely on road networks with graph structures and learn representations using graph neural networks (GNNs), but this approach suffers from over-smoothing problem in deep architectures.

item.title: Template-free Articulated Neural Point Clouds for Reposable View Synthesis
item.description: We demonstrate the versatility of our representation on a variety of articulated objects from common datasets and obtain reposable 3D reconstructions without the need of object-specific skeletal templates.

item.title: HQDec: Self-Supervised Monocular Depth Estimation Based on a High-Quality Decoder
item.description: To this end, we propose a high-quality decoder (HQDec), with which multilevel near-lossless fine-grained information, obtained by the proposed adaptive axial-normalized position-embedded channel attention sampling module (AdaAxialNPCAS), can be adaptively incorporated into a low-resolution feature map with high-level semantics utilizing the proposed adaptive information exchange scheme.

item.title: Empirical Sufficiency Lower Bounds for Language Modeling with Locally-Bootstrapped Semantic Structures
item.description: In this work we build upon negative results from an attempt at language modeling with predicted semantic structure, in order to establish empirical lower bounds on what could have made the attempt successful.

item.title: Intrinsic shape analysis in archaeology: A case study on ancient sundials
item.description: By performing regression in shape space, we find that for Roman sundials, the bend of the sundials' shadow-receiving surface changes with the location's latitude.

item.title: PyPOTS: A Python Toolbox for Data Mining on Partially-Observed Time Series
item.description: PyPOTS is an open-source Python library dedicated to data mining and analysis on multivariate partially-observed time series, i. e. incomplete time series with missing values, A. K. A.

item.title: Scalable Performance Analysis for Vision-Language Models
item.description: Joint vision-language models have shown great performance over a diverse set of tasks.

item.title: Align, Perturb and Decouple: Toward Better Leverage of Difference Information for RSI Change Detection
item.description: In this paper, we revisit the importance of feature difference for change detection in RSI, and propose a series of operations to fully exploit the difference information: Alignment, Perturbation and Decoupling (APD).

item.title: Known by the Company it Keeps: Proximity-Based Indexing for Physical Content in Archival Repositories
item.description: Despite the plethora of born-digital content, vast troves of important content remain accessible only on physical media such as paper or microfilm.

item.title: Design and implementation of intelligent packet filtering in IoT microcontroller-based devices
item.description: Our evaluation shows that T800 is an efficient solution that increases device computational capacity by excluding unsolicited malicious traffic from the processing pipeline.

item.title: Encouraging Divergent Thinking in Large Language Models through Multi-Agent Debate
item.description: To address the DoT problem, we propose a Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) framework, in which multiple agents express their arguments in the state of "tit for tat" and a judge manages the debate process to obtain a final solution.

item.title: Concise Answers to Complex Questions: Summarization of Long-form Answers
item.description: Long-form question answering systems provide rich information by presenting paragraph-level answers, often containing optional background or auxiliary information.

item.title: The Magic of IF: Investigating Causal Reasoning Abilities in Large Language Models of Code
item.description: Causal reasoning, the ability to identify cause-and-effect relationship, is crucial in human thinking.

item.title: The Information Retrieval Experiment Platform
item.description: Standardization is achieved when a retrieval approach implements PyTerrier's interfaces and the input and output of an experiment are compatible with ir_datasets and ir_measures.

item.title: Exploring the Promise and Limits of Real-Time Recurrent Learning
item.description: To scale to such challenging tasks, we focus on certain well-known neural architectures with element-wise recurrence, allowing for tractable RTRL without approximation.

item.title: Sit Back and Relax: Learning to Drive Incrementally in All Weather Conditions
item.description: We propose to store these affine parameters as a memory bank for each weather condition and plug-in their weather-specific parameters during driving (i. e. test time) when the respective weather conditions are encountered.

item.title: Asymptotic Characterisation of Robust Empirical Risk Minimisation Performance in the Presence of Outliers
item.description: We examine in detail how performance depends on the loss function and on the degree of outlier corruption in the training set and identify a region of parameters where the optimal performance of the Huber loss is identical to that of the $\ell_2$ loss, offering insights into the use cases of different loss functions.

item.title: Occ-BEV: Multi-Camera Unified Pre-training via 3D Scene Reconstruction
item.description: The proposed multi-camera unified pre-training framework demonstrates promising results in key tasks such as multi-camera 3D object detection and semantic scene completion.

item.title: Client: Cross-variable Linear Integrated Enhanced Transformer for Multivariate Long-Term Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Long-term time series forecasting (LTSF) is a crucial aspect of modern society, playing a pivotal role in facilitating long-term planning and developing early warning systems.

item.title: Ambient Diffusion: Learning Clean Distributions from Corrupted Data
item.description: We present the first diffusion-based framework that can learn an unknown distribution using only highly-corrupted samples.

item.title: Evaluating the feasibility of using Generative Models to generate Chest X-Ray Data
item.description: In this paper, we explore the feasibility of using generative models, specifically Progressive Growing GANs (PG-GANs) and Stable Diffusion fine-tuning, to generate synthetic chest X-ray images for medical diagnosis purposes.

item.title: Joint Optimization of Class-Specific Training- and Test-Time Data Augmentation in Segmentation
item.description: We demonstrate the effectiveness of our method on four medical image segmentation tasks across different scenarios with two state-of-the-art segmentation models, DeepMedic and nnU-Net.

item.title: Reduced Precision Floating-Point Optimization for Deep Neural Network On-Device Learning on MicroControllers
item.description: Enabling On-Device Learning (ODL) for Ultra-Low-Power Micro-Controller Units (MCUs) is a key step for post-deployment adaptation and fine-tuning of Deep Neural Network (DNN) models in future TinyML applications.

item.title: Edge-MoE: Memory-Efficient Multi-Task Vision Transformer Architecture with Task-level Sparsity via Mixture-of-Experts
item.description: Computer vision researchers are embracing two promising paradigms: Vision Transformers (ViTs) and Multi-task Learning (MTL), which both show great performance but are computation-intensive, given the quadratic complexity of self-attention in ViT and the need to activate an entire large MTL model for one task.

item.title: Wide & deep learning for spatial & intensity adaptive image restoration
item.description: The wide & deep architecture in DparNet enables the learned parameters to directly modulate the final restoring results, boosting spatial & intensity adaptive image restoration.

item.title: An Annotated Dataset for Explainable Interpersonal Risk Factors of Mental Disturbance in Social Media Posts
item.description: With a surge in identifying suicidal risk and its severity in social media posts, we argue that a more consequential and explainable research is required for optimal impact on clinical psychology practice and personalized mental healthcare.

item.title: Fighting Bias with Bias: Promoting Model Robustness by Amplifying Dataset Biases
item.description: We suggest that in order to drive the development of models robust to subtle biases, dataset biases should be amplified in the training set.

item.title: dotears: Scalable, consistent DAG estimation using observational and interventional data
item.description: We extend previous work to show, both empirically and analytically, that the inferences of previous methods are driven by exogenous variance structure, but $\texttt{dotears}$ is robust to exogenous variance structure.

item.title: Probabilistic Computation with Emerging Covariance: towards efficient uncertainty quantification
item.description: Building robust, interpretable, and secure artificial intelligence system requires some degree of quantifying and representing uncertainty via a probabilistic perspective, as it allows to mimic human cognitive abilities.

item.title: Towards single integrated spoofing-aware speaker verification embeddings
item.description: Second, competitive performance should be demonstrated compared to the fusion of automatic speaker verification (ASV) and countermeasure (CM) embeddings, which outperformed single embedding solutions by a large margin in the SASV2022 challenge.

item.title: Large-scale Ridesharing DARP Instances Based on Real Travel Demand
item.description: With the rise of large MoD systems and the availability of open travel demand datasets for many US cities, there is now an opportunity to evaluate these algorithms on standardized, realistic, and representative instances.

item.title: Testing for the Markov Property in Time Series via Deep Conditional Generative Learning
item.description: In this article, we propose a nonparametric test for the Markov property in high-dimensional time series via deep conditional generative learning.

item.title: Real-World Image Variation by Aligning Diffusion Inversion Chain
item.description: However, a domain gap exists between generated images and real-world images, which poses a challenge in generating high-quality variations of real-world images.

item.title: Generating with Confidence: Uncertainty Quantification for Black-box Large Language Models
item.description: In this work, we investigate uncertainty quantification in NLG for $\textit{black-box}$ LLMs.
